sentinel.led
Class ECAAgent

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--sentinel.led.ECAAgent
public class ECAAgent
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains the API to be used for Sentinel applications. With this API, the user can create class level and instance level Primitive events, Composite events and define rules on those events in different parameter contexts (RECENT, CHRONICLE, CONTINUOUS, CUMULATIVE). The user also raises the events through the 'raiseEvent' API. This class is a public class since it is accessed by all user applications.

Method Detail

initializeECAAgent

public static ECAAgent initializeECAAgent()
This method initializes some of the data structures used by the Local Event Detector (LED). It is essential that this method is called in the user application before creating any events and rules. LED is not started if this method is not called. Since it is a static method, it can be directly called on the ECAAgent class.

initializeECAAgent

public static ECAAgent initializeECAAgent(java.lang.String agentName)
This method initializes and returns a named ECAAgent.

getAgentInstance

public static ECAAgent getAgentInstance(java.lang.String agentName)
This method is used to obtain a named ECAAgent instance from the application.

getEventHandles

public static EventHandle[] getEventHandles(java.lang.String eventName)
This method is used to obtain the event handles for the event specified by eventName. It returns an array of event handles since the same event could be created in multiple ECAAgent instances.

createPrimitiveEvent

public EventHandle createPrimitiveEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                                        java.lang.String className,
                                        EventModifier eventModifier,
                                        java.lang.String methodSignature)
This method creates a Primitive event with the given event name.
Parameters:
eventName - The name of the Primitive event.
className - The name of the Java class raising the event.
eventModifier - The point of event occurence (begin or end).
methodSignature - The method signature for this event.
The event modifier specifies whether the event occurs in the beginning of the method or the end of the method.

createPrimitiveEvent

public EventHandle createPrimitiveEvent(java.lang.String eventName,
                                        java.lang.String className,
                                        EventModifier eventModifier,
                                        java.lang.String methodSignature,
                                        DetectionMode detectMode)
This method creates a Primitive event with the given event name.
Parameters:
eventName - The name of the Primitive event.
className - The name of the Java class raising the event.
eventModifier - The point of event occurence (begin or end).
methodSignature - The method signature for this event.
detectMode - This argument specifies whether the primitive event should be detected in SYNCHRONOUS or PARALLEL mode.

                                        java.lang.String eventName,
                                        EventHandle leftEvent,
                                        java.lang.String timeString,
                                        java.lang.Object instance,
                                        EventHandle rightEvent)

Parameters:
eventType - The ternary operator used for the composite event.
eventName - The name of the composite event.
leftEvent - The event handle of the left event.
timeString - The time expression for the middle event.
instance - The object whose value is being monitored in the interval specified by the left and right events.
rightEvent - The event handle of the right event.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName)
This method creates a rule with the default context, coupling mode, triggering mode and priority. Default Context : RECENT Default Coupling mode : IMMEDIATE Default Trigger mode : NOW Default Priority : 1
Parameters:
ruleName - The name of the Rule.
eventName - The name of the Event on which this Rule is defined.
condName - The fully qualified name of the condition method with the class name and method name.
actionName - The fully qualified name of the action method with the class name and method name.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       int priority)
This method takes the user given priority for the Rule.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       int priority,
                       CouplingMode coupling)
This method takes the user given Coupling mode for the Rule. The symbolic names for the different coupling modes are CouplingMode.IMMEDIATE, CouplingMode.DEFERRED and CouplingMode.DETACHED.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       int priority,
                       CouplingMode coupling,
                       ParamContext context)
This method takes the user given context for the rule. The symbolic names for the different contexts are Context.RECENT, Context.CHRONICLE, Context.CONTINUOUS and Context.CUMULATIVE.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       int priority,
                       CouplingMode coupling,
                       ParamContext context,
                       TriggerMode triggerMode)
This method takes the user given Triggering mode for the Rule. The symbolic names for the different trigger modes are TriggerMode.NOW and TriggerMode.PREVIOUS.

This method creates an instance level rule on the specified object instance.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.Object targetInstance,
                       java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       java.lang.Object instance)
This method creates an instance level rule on the specified object instance. When the event occurs, this object target instance (an instance in any class) can invoke a declared condition and action. This method creates an instance level rule on the specified object instance.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.String ruleName,
                       Reactive reactive,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName)
This method creates a rule of class level with dafault Context, CounplingMode , Trigger mode, and priority. added by seyang on 24 July 99
Parameters:
reactive - a value of type 'Reactive'
eventHandle - a value of type 'EventHandle'
condName - a value of type 'String'
actionName - a value of type 'String'

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.String ruleName,
                       Reactive reactive,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       Condition condition,
                       Action action)
This method will create a rule on reactive oject with Condition, Action interface
Parameters:
reactive - a value of type 'Reactive'
eventHandle - a value of type 'EventHandle'
condition - a value of type 'Condition'
action - a value of type 'Action'
Returns:
a value of type 'Rule'

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.Object targetInstance,
                       java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName)
This method creates an class level rule. When the event occurs, this target rule instance will invoke a declared condition and action.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.Object targetInstance,
                       java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       int priority)
This method creates an class level rule. When the event occurs, this target rule instance will invoke a declared condition and action. This method takes the user given priority for the Rule.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.Object targetInstance,
                       java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       int priority,
                       CouplingMode coupling)
This method creates an class level rule. When the event occurs, this target rule instance will invoke a declared condition and action. This method takes the user given Coupling mode for the Rule. The symbolic names for the different coupling modes are CouplingMode.IMMEDIATE, CouplingMode.DEFERRED and CouplingMode.DETACHED.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.Object targetInstance,
                       java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       int priority,
                       CouplingMode coupling,
                       ParamContext context)
This method creates an class level rule. When the event occurs, this target rule instance will invoke a declared condition and action. This method takes the user given context for the rule. The symbolic names for the different contexts are ParamContext.RECENT, ParamContext.CHRONICLE, ParamContext.CONTINUOUS and ParamContext.CUMULATIVE.

createRule

public Rule createRule(java.lang.Object targetInstance,
                       java.lang.String ruleName,
                       EventHandle eventHandle,
                       java.lang.String condName,
                       java.lang.String actionName,
                       int priority,
                       CouplingMode coupling,
                       ParamContext context,
                       TriggerMode triggerMode)
This method creates an class level rule. When the event occurs, this target rule instance will invoke a declared condition and action. This method takes the user given Triggering mode for the Rule. The symbolic names for the different trigger modes are TriggerMode.NOW and TriggerMode.PREVIOUS.

replaceRule

public Rule replaceRule(Rule ruleNode,
                        Condition condition,
                        Action action)
This method replace the condition and action code of rule.
Parameters:
ruleNode - Rule Object
Condition - Condition Function Object
Action - Action Function Object

disableRule

public void disableRule(java.lang.String ruleName)
This method is used to disable a rule given its name.
Parameters:
ruleName - The name of the rule to be disabled

enableRule

public void enableRule(java.lang.String ruleName)
This method is used to enable a disabled rule.
Parameters:
ruleName - The name of the rule to be enabled

deleteRule

public void deleteRule(java.lang.String ruleName)
This method is used to delete a rule given its name.
Parameters:
ruleName - The name of the rule to be deleted

                                   java.lang.Object instance)
This method raises an event at the beginning of a method.
Parameters:
eventHandle - The reference to the event handle associated with the primitive event.
instance - The reference of the instance raising the event.

eventHandle - The reference to the event handle associated with the primitive event.
instance - The reference of the instance raising the event.

putIntoNotifyBuffer

protected static void putIntoNotifyBuffer(NotifyObject notifyObj,
                                          ECAAgent ecaAgent,
                                          java.lang.Thread currThread,
                                          ProcessRuleList processRuleList)
This method is used to take care of waiting immediated child mechanism. It'll put the notify Object into the buffer and wait for the completion of its child
